titles.title: Veterans Health Care Budget Reform Act of 2008

A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize advance appropriations for certain medical care accounts of the Department of Veterans Affairs by providing two-fiscal year budget authority.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S9037-9038)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

bill.summary:
9/18/2008--Introduced.
Veterans Health Care Budget Reform Act of 2008 - Requires, beginning with FY2010, a two-fiscal-year budget authority for the following accounts of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA): (1) Medical Services; (2) Medical Administration; and (3) Medical Facilities. Requires the Comptroller General to conduct a study on the adequacy and accuracy of VA baseline model projections for health care expenditures.
